editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Thompson Family Charitable Trust

msDesc.head: Ambrose, De officiis; Life of Saint George, Latin verse

msItem.rubric: Incipit liber AMBROSII Mediolanensis Archiepiscopi de Officiis ministrorum
msItem.incipit: Non arrogans uideri arbitror si inter filios suscipiam affectum docendi
msItem.explicit: series tamen uetustatis quodam compendio expressa plurimum instructionis conferat Amen
msItem.author: Ambrose
msItem.title: De officiis
msItem.note: CPL 144, ed. Maurice Testard, Les Dévoirs, 2 vols. (Paris 1984–92). Only six text lines in the last column, the remainder of the folio blank.

msItem.rubric: Incipit prefatio De passione Gloriosj martyris cristi Georgij
msItem.incipit: Gloriosi martyris Georgii passionem uenerandam licet nobis ab antiquis fideli relatione traditam
msItem.rubric: [fol. 56ra, the text] Incipit passio Gloriosi martyris Georgij sub daciano Imperatore
msItem.incipit: Imperator dacianus cum in omnes fidei cristiane professores generalem persecutionis acerrime dictaret
msItem.explicit: [fol. 70vb] passionem euis nobis in cunctis necessitatibus salutarem senciamus intercessionem prestante deo et domino nostro [form ending] Amen |
msItem.rubric: [fol. 71ra] Incipiunt lectiones compendiose de passione beati Georgii Martyris excepte Lectio ia.
msItem.incipit: Imperator dacianus cum in omnes fidei cristiane professores generalem persecutiones acerrime
msItem.explicit: in presenti sue perspexerit passionis memores glorie sue faciat in futuro consortes Amen
msItem.title: Life of Saint George

msItem.rubric: Incipit Proemium in Tractatum Rithmice compositum de Laude Crucis
msItem.incipit: Ad salutifere crucis signaculum | Diuino munere saluantis seculum
msItem.explicit: Ut ad te ueniam qui fons es uenie | Uisimus gloriam celestis curie Amen
msItem.title: Latin verse
msItem.note: WIC 436; he cites another copy, BL, MS Royal 2 A.ix, fol. 36.

msItem.rubric: Incipit Salutoria oracio ad beatam virginem
msItem.incipit: Aue Maria Salue mater misericordie | Fons emanans iugis clemencie
msItem.explicit: Quos ab omni mortis supplicio | Tui uultus absoluat uisio amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit Oratio Salutatoria de Beata virgine Maria
msItem.title: Latin verse

msItem.rubric: Incipit libellus qui Intitulatur Fauus mellis
msItem.incipit: Mellis fauus ministris apibus | E diuersis fit agri floribus
msItem.explicit: crux cristi preuia | Viam parans ad vite gaudia Amen
msItem.title: Latin verse
msItem.note: WIC 10875; there treated as unique and including the next, but both also appear as BodL, MS Bodley 79, fol. 1. Followed by a 4-line prayer ‘Et si fandi desit pericia—Cor loquatur et consciencia’, as well as by a contents table in double columns, fol. 85vb.

msItem.incipit: Pater sancte quem in celis semper esse credimus | Cuius sedes mens fidelis
msItem.explicit: Vt uel pena mitior fiat tormentorum | Vel salus celerior in te saluandorum Amen
msItem.title: Latin verse
msItem.note: WIC 13815 (citing this work separately from item 5, again as unique). A verse litany, including, among others, George, Denis, Blaise, Ædmund, Alban, Oswald, Ædward, Thomas Becket, Cuthbert, Birin, Swithin, Ædward, Guthlac, and Ædburga. Blanks in the contents table correspond to unfilled spaces awaiting text at fols. 98ra, 108va–110vb. Fol. 111rb is blank but ruled, the verso blank.

supportDesc.collation: 1–410 514 [fol. 54, a booklet boundary] | 610+1 (+1) 710+1 (+11) [fol. 76, a booklet boundary] | 88 9–1010 1110 (–8, –9, –10, presumably all blank). There are possible further booklet bounds at fol. 40v, where there is no catchword and book 2 of item 1 ends; and at fol. 84v, the end of item 4. In booklet 1: one catchword under the inner column (fol. 20v); all leaves in the first half of each quire signed, with letters a–e (–g in quire 5). No signatures in quire 3; in red ink except for quire 5 (green ink). In booklet 2: no catchwords; all leaves in the first half of each quire (excepting the supplied leaf fol. 55) signed, the letters a–e in quire 6, roman numerals in red ink in quire 7. In booklet 3: no catchwords or signatures.

layoutDesc.layout: (a) to fol. 76, each column 168–73 51–2 , with 13 mm between columns, in 34 lines to the column;

(b) thereafter, each column
178 59–61 , with 12 mm between columns, in 43 lines to the column.
Prickings rare, bounded and ruled in brown crayon (first portion) and black ink (second).

handDesc.handNote: The first two booklets (fols. 1–76) written in transitional protogothic bookhand/gothic textura, fols. 55v and 76v perhaps in a second hand; the final booklet in gothic textura semiquadrata (in some places, prescissa), perhaps by more than one scribe. Punctuation by point, punctus elevatus, punctus interrogativus, and occasional double point and punctus flexus (booklets 1–2); and by point and punctus elevatus at line ends (booklet 3).

decoDesc.decoNote: In early portions (the first quire and text 2 only), red headings and running titles.
Textual sections open with 2-line alternating red and green arabesque initials; on fol. 1, blue and red lombards on flourishing of the other colour.
In the verse, alternate red and gold or red and green arabesque initials at section heads and 1-line examples at the head of each quatrain (other lines have larger pen-and-ink initials).

binding.p: A modern replacement. Sewn on two thongs. At the front, a modern marbled paper leaf and one modern paper flyleaf; at the rear, another marbled paper leaf (iii).

history.acquisition: ‘Iohannes white de Suthwyke in Comitatu Sutht armiger dedit hunc librum Thome white de london militi ad vsum colegij per ipsum de nouo erecti in Oxon’ Anno 1555’ (fol. 1, upper margin).

source.bibl: Ralph Hanna, A descriptive catalogue of the western medieval manuscripts of St. John's College, Oxford (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2002)

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact St John's College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Eligius Dekkers and Aemilius Gaar, Clavis patrum latinorum, 3rd edn. (Turnhout, 1995).
Hans Walther, Initia carminum ac versuum Medii Aevi posterioris Latinorum, 2nd edn (Göttingen, 1969).
